definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

pinyin: Zhong1 Ri4 Han2 tong3 yi1 biao3 yi4 wen2 zi4

sentences.english: I was touched by the culture belt between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 中日的文化有着如此緊密的聯繫使我感動不已。

sentences.english: The growth of our business ties has slowed down in recent years, showing a lack of sustained momentum.
sentences.chinese: 中日經貿關係近年來發展勢頭趨緩，後續動力不足。

sentences.english: "Neighbors separated only by a strip of water." This expression has been employed for a long time to describe the diplomatic communication and the friendship between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一衣帶水一直被用來形容中日兩國之間的邦交與友誼。

sentences.english: The issue revolves around the behaviour of Chinese and Japanese students.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題主要圍繞着中日留學生的表現。

sentences.english: How is this year's Sino-Japan Chess Challenge Tournament going on?
sentences.chinese: 今年的中日圍棋擂臺賽進行得如何？

sentences.english: Wen said parliamentary exchanges are a vital part of Japan-China ties.
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶表示，議會交流是中日關係的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: China and Japan enjoy a wide range of areas of cooperation and have many undertakings to be promoted jointly.
sentences.chinese: 中日合作領域很廣，需要共同推動的事業很多。

sentences.english: Both sides mainly exchanged in-depth opinions on China-Japan relations.
sentences.chinese: 雙方着重就中日關係問題深入交換了意見。

sentences.english: The 2nd trilateral meeting was held in Beijing in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 第二次中日韓領導人會議2009年在北京舉行。

sentences.english: The leaders of ASEAN, China, Japan and Korea issued the Kuala Lumpur Declaration.
sentences.chinese: 東盟和中日韓領導人在會上發表了《吉隆坡宣言》。

sentences.english: At present, Sino-Japanese economic ties are not heating up along with cold political ties.
sentences.chinese: 當今中日關係的現狀是“政溫經不熱”。

sentences.english: Wang Yi indicated that the sea border of the East China Sea has not been decided and China and Japan have disputes over this issue.
sentences.chinese: 王毅指出，東海尚未劃界，中日在此問題上存在爭議。

sentences.english: No rain from noon till night.
Abe's resignation will have little impact on Sino-Japanese relations, Liu said.
sentences.chinese: 劉江勇認爲，安倍的辭職對中日關係的影響微乎其微。

sentences.english: At best they were taken over following the first Sino-Japanese War in 1895.
sentences.chinese: 他們是在1895年中日戰爭後被佔領的。

sentences.english: Japan and china are close neighbours separated by only a strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中日兩國一衣帶水，隋唐以前，兩國已有文化交往。

definition: the Japanese side or party (in negotiations etc)
South Korea (Republic of Korea)/Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄[zhan4 guo2 qi1 xiong2]/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897
the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
